channel.title: Blue Star Markers in North Carolina
channel.description: At the close of World War II National Garden Clubs, like other public spirited groups, was seeking a suitable means of honoring our service men and women. Garden Club members visualized a living memorial, preferring to help beautify and preserve the country these men and women had fought for, rather than build stone monuments in their honor.

item.title: Central Pea Island 2011 Breach Area
item.description: The breach following Hurricane Irene in 2011.

item.title: Location of Temporary Bridge
item.description: This is the location of the breach where NCDOT located a temporary bridge in the Fall of 2011.

item.title: South Pea Island 2011 Breach Area
item.description: The breach caused on this portion of NC 12 by Hurricane Irene in 2011.

item.title: S-Curves/Rodanthe 2011 Breach Area
item.description: NCDOT filled the breaches caused by Hurricane Irene on this stretch of NC 12 in the Fall of 2011.

item.title: Start of Buxton-Canadian Hole Hot Spot Project Area TIP No. R-4070 B
item.description: The Buxton/Canadian Hole “hot spot” (TIP No. R-4070 B) begins near SR 1231 in Buxton and extends north approximately 4.7 miles to SR 1421. A portion of NC 12 in this area was relocated shortly after Hurricane Dennis in 1999, but flooding and overwash still occur at the north and south ends.

item.title: End of Buxton/Canadian Hole Hot Spot Project Area
item.description: The Buxton/Canadian Hole “hot spot” (TIP No. R-4070 B) begins near SR 1231 in Buxton and extends north approximately 4.7 miles to SR 1421. A portion of NC 12 in this area was relocated shortly after Hurricane Dennis in 1999, but flooding and overwash still occur at the north and south ends.

item.title: Start of Hatteras Village Hot Spot Project Area
item.description:
The Hatteras Village "hot spot" (TIP No. R-3116 B) begins extends 1.7 miles just south of the Frisco village limits to Elizabeth Avenue in Hatteras Village and extends north 1.7 miles.
STIP #. R-3116 B

item.title: End of Hatteras Village Hot Spot Project Area
item.description: The Hatteras Village "hot spot" (TIP No. R-3116 B) runs between Elizabeth Avenue in Hatteras Village to just south of the Frisco village limits for about 1.7 miles.

item.title: Start of Ocracoke Island Hot Spot Project Area-TIP# R-3116 A
item.description: The Ocracoke Island "hot spot" (TIP No. R-3116 A) begins just south of the Hatteras ferry terminal continues 4 miles southward on Ocracoke Island.

item.title: End of Ocracoke Island Hot Spot Project Area TIP# R-3116 A
item.description:
The Ocracoke Island "hot spot" (TIP No. R-3116 A) begins just south of the Hatteras ferry terminal continues 4 miles southward on Ocracoke Island.
523,978.5248 North
2,935,399.6089 East
